JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;Ján Šikuta;Lech Garlicki;Nicolas Bratza;Päivi Hirvelä;Stanislav Pavlovschi
TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , was a NORP national who was born in DATE , died in DATE and lived in GPE , GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON and subsequently by PERSON of ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

The applicant lived in a semi - detached house in ORG . In DATE the house situated on the adjacent plot of land was sold . The new owner - “ PERSON L ” - demolished it and began to construct a building there .

On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) issued preliminary planning permission authorising PERSON to continue the construction of the building for residential and/or commercial purposes . On DATE , on an appeal by the applicant , ORG ( ORG ) quashed it and remitted the case . On DATE ORG ordered all the construction works to be stopped and the building area to be secured .

On DATE ORG gave a decision confirming that the intended construction could be located in the specified area ( decyzja o ustaleniu warunków zabudowy i zagospodarowania terenu ) . On DATE ORG of Appeal in ORG ( PERSON ) quashed this decision and remitted the case .
On DATE ORG gave a decision ordering PERSON to secure the building area by constructing a special wall . In DATE PERSON proceeded with the construction of the building .

On DATE ORG delivered a second planning permission ( decyzja o ustaleniu warunków zabudowy i zagospodarowania terenu ) concerning the location of the intended construction . It refused permission for construction of a car repair garage and held that it was only possible to locate a car accessory shop on the site . This decision was later upheld by ORG , on DATE . The applicant lodged an appeal with ORG ( PERSON ) .

On DATE ORG gave a decision discontinuing the administrative proceedings as regards the safety requirements . It was established that PERSON had fulfilled all the necessary requirements as regards the security of the adjacent building .

On DATE ORG ordered PERSON to demolish part of the constructed building as it had been built without the appropriate building permit ( pozwolenie na budowę ) . On DATE ORG again ordered PERSON to demolish part of the new building .

On DATE ORG issued a building permit in favour of PERSON and allowed her to construct a car accessory shop . On DATE ORG quashed this decision and remitted the case . It held that as the construction works had begun and been carried out illegally , the case should be considered under LAW ( Prawo budowlane ) . On DATE ORG allowed the construction of the car accessory shop on the site . This decision was again quashed by ORG on DATE .
On DATE ORG delivered yet another decision allowing the construction of a car accessory shop and a shop selling new cars on the adjacent plot .

On DATE ORG gave judgment and quashed the decision of DATE . It held that according to the local development plan , the planned construction was in a zone designated as residential . While it was possible to allow for such developments as grocery shops and local services , the construction of a car sales point or a car accessory shop was not a development of that kind .
On DATE ORG quashed the decision of DATE and remitted the case .
On DATE ORG ordered PERSON to stop the construction works as they had been carried out without an appropriate permit . On CARDINAL DATE ORG upheld this decision .

On DATE ORG quashed the decision of DATE . It held that since DATE the construction works on PERSON plot had been carried out illegally and that the administrative authorities had been fully aware of that fact .

On DATE the District Inspector of Construction Supervision ( Powiatowy Inspektor Nadzoru Budowlanego ) ordered the garage to be demolished . This decision was upheld by ORG ( ORG Inspektor PERSON ) on DATE . On DATE the District Inspector of Construction Supervision imposed a fine on PERSON as she had failed to comply with this order . This decision was upheld by ORG on DATE .

Meanwhile , on DATE ORG ( ORG Inspektor PERSON ) informed the applicant that there had been an inspection of PERSON building . During the inspection it was established that no repairing or spraying of cars was taking place . At the same time , the inspector reiterated that he was not competent to decide on the legality of the adjacent building .
On DATE ORG decided to stay the enforcement of the decision of DATE . The court noted that enforcement of this decision before PERSON appeal was examined could expose her to irreversible damage .
On DATE PERSON sought to have the decision of ORG declared null and void . On DATE and DATE ORG refused to declare this decision null and void . On DATE ORG dismissed a further appeal by PERSON
